title: What is the career scope in future for Information Technology if I decide to pursue a career in it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok here is the truth, its not for all. Pros: The starting salaries are great. Work environment will be the best in most cases. You are a mind worker which should keep you out of boredom completely and zip through time, work weeks feel shorter, unless you are benched or in support. No physical labor unless you are in networking even then you have support staff. Cons: Technology landscape changes day to day and so does your worth to the company unless you update constantly — life long learning. If you are slow or your company focuses narrowly on just a few clients and their technology you will have no career in a few years as you get outdated. You will find it harder landing jobs and keeping them once you reach higher salaries as if they dont get projects they lay off highest salaries first. The new trend is to train freshers on new technologies and pay them 10x lesser than a seasoned professional with technology expertise. You may end up a piece worker, you cannot deliver a whole product on your own, analysis, design, testing, implementation and focus geat narrower as there is broad spectrum of competing frameworks in each part and some settle for one expertise which can be automared or completely changed any day and you are back in the market competing with freshers. Even the best companies pay you less than a burger flipper minimim wages in the clients location in most cases. 20$ an hour = $160/day. 25days x 160 x 65 inr = Rs.2,60,000/— No matter who you think you are the above figures tell an aweful truth. Freshers are likely happy with 24k a month, but thats why India is such a piece of cake. On the flip side if you continue working directly with clients, freelancing on the net and not have to put up with all the nonsense managers and the office politics just to have a “respectable position" you could become a millionaire. In India we are all about position and company, we are here to satisfy our parents egos and close family than just live well. Chances are you wont even find a good proposal without it, so we repeat the same mistakes. So finally the question is: Do you enjoy continuous learning? Can you speak decent English ? Can you freelance and manage clients ? Are you hardworking and can manage high levels of stress ? Can you accept that by the end of your career everything you know will be useless and what you then know may also be useless but you should hopefully have found a stable ground or have otherwise ended up as some manager spilling out outdated gyan to bored teams , that is if you are employed at all :)… Finally in any industry you believe you put your life into the company and they should be greatful to you, your accomplishments and your efforts. The company will most definately see you as their burden that they paid and managed for so long. Its only a matter of perspective. I have seen certificates lying around my office worthless as pieces of paper as employees are given meritorious certificates for 10-20 years of service and if you are lucky a party and maybe the very lucky ones a double pay or pay raise. You should see their moment of realization of their worth and “loyalty”. If you are truly great, you get to double your salary at each job change and must only remain on that job till you are highly valued, but nothing beats freelancing.

I think I have written some answers for similar questions earlier; however, each day the scope is expanding and there is more room for new set of answers; First is to determine your career mind set interns of your ability, sustenance and competencies; it is important that you choose a career path that you will cherish in the long run and as well as you will sustain your enthusiasm to propel; There is a long list of career options available for you to pick & choose; you can go to any job site and just type IT or any of the slang that you are aware, you will get a volume list; however, narrow it down to the current demands and quickly check on which are the companies are in the fore-front of these requirements; this will give you a fair idea of how the career options exist as on date; Moving ahead, you need to have the ability to swim with the tide and keep expanding your horizon thru continuous training shift or thru rigorous self development; your ultimate goals is to become proficient and high on demand growth trajectory. Programming is not the only option in IT; there are many and varied options available; the key is to bring continuous out-of-the box thinking capability as you keep growing in the selected career; that is why you will see lot of entry and exit options are available only in IT filed; just to cross check this, checkout the job opportunities that exist in the job portals on IT and Non-IT skills, you will be amazed to see that the IT skills occupies huge number of ADs etc., Lastly, if you don’t keep pace with the speed in IT career, you will land-up insuch positions that can never see the light of the day; All the very best,

The carrer in IT field is quite good and the salaries mjght get more in coming future.
